column5: * Oi  Petrobras  Vale lead Brazil shares' gains     * Bovespa due to break six-month losing streak     * Brazil's Bovespa up 2.48 pct  Mexico's IPC gains 0.57 pct       MEXICO CITY  July 22 Latin American stocks gained on Monday as investors anticipated the release of second-quarter corporate earnings reports  with key bourses advancing their recent rally.     Brazil's benchmark Bovespa index jumped as commodity stocks performed well  while Mexico's IPC index and Chile's bourse also

column4: EMERGING MARKETS-Brazil stocks extend rally as U.S. markets rise
column5: * Petrobras  OGX  Vale lead gains     * Bovespa due to break 6-month losing streak     * Brazil Bovespa up 1.18 pct  Mexico IPC gains 0.26 pct      By Lucas Iberico-Lozada     SAO PAULO  July 22 Brazilian stocks extended a recent rally on Monday  led by oil producers and commodities exporters as the benchmark Bovespa index continued to track world markets higher.     Mexico's IPC index edged higher  while Chile's bourse  was little changed.     Last week  Brazil's Bovespa index saw i

column4: Ousted SandRidge CEO Ward sold 10 mln shares after being ousted
column5: NEW YORK  July 22 Ousted SandRidge Energy Inc  Chief Executive Tom Ward sold nearly 10 million of the oil and gas company's shares after he was fired last month  bringing in about $47.4 million in proceeds.

column4: Germany's SAP to make McDermott sole CEO from 2014
column5: FRANKFURT German software maker SAP AG is breaking up its dual-CEO structure and giving sole executive power to Bill McDermott  only weeks after his co-CEO Jim Hagemann Snabe defended the power-sharing structure in a newspaper interview.

column4: REFILE-UPDATE 2-Germany's SAP to make McDermott sole CEO from 2014
column5: FRANKFURT  July 22 German software maker SAP AG  is breaking up its dual-CEO structure and giving sole executive power to Bill McDermott  only weeks after his co-CEO Jim Hagemann Snabe defended the power-sharing structure in a newspaper interview.

column4: Klepierre eyes cash gains as malls resist slowdown
column5: PARIS  July 22 French real-estate group Klepierre  co-owned by Simon Property and BNP Paribas   said it was targeting higher-than-expected cash flows this year as its shopping malls resist Europe's slowdown.

column4: UPDATE 1-Woman died from accidental fall off Six Flags roller coaster -coroner
column5: DALLAS  July 22 A woman who plunged from a roller coaster at the Six Flags Over Texas amusement park died of multiple traumatic injuries in a fall that was ruled an accident  authorities said on Monday.

column4: CORRECTED-Woman died from accidental fall off Six Flags roller coaster -coroner
column5: DALLAS  July 22 A woman who plunged from a roller coaster at the Six Flags Over Texas amusement park died of multiple traumatic injuries in a fall that was ruled an accident  authorities said on Monday.

column4: Telefonica in talks to buy KPN's German business
column5: MADRID/LONDON Telefonica  and KPN  are in talks to combine their German mobile businesses in a deal worth over $6 billion that would help them compete with bigger competitors Deutsche Telekom  and Vodafone .

column4: UPDATE 2-Telefonica in talks to buy KPN's German business
column5: * Telefonica would pay $6 bln and give KPN stake in new firm

column4: Telefonica to buy KPN's German unit with cash  shares -sources
column5: MADRID  July 22 Spanish telecoms company Telefonica is offering cash as well as shares of its German unit O2 to buy KPN's German business E-Plus  three sources close to the deal told Reuters on Monday.

column4: Telefonica confirms in talks over possible deal in Germany
column5: MADRID  July 22 Spanish telecoms company Telefonica confirmed on Monday it was in talks over a possible deal in Germany but added that nothing was closed yet.

column4: UPDATE 1-Telefonica in talks to buy KPN's German business
column5: * Telefonica  KPN boards meet Monday to approve deal-source

column4: Spain's Telefonica in talks to buy KPN's German unit-source
column5: MADRID  July 22 Spain's Telefonica is in advanced talks to buy KPN's German unit E-Plus in a 5-billion-euro ($6.6 billion) deal  a source with knowledge of the matter said on Monday.

column4: Time Inc getting new CEO ahead of magazine unit spinoff
column5: Time Warner Inc said it named a new chief executive to head its magazine titles People  Sports Illustrated and Time  which will soon be separated from the media conglomerate.

column4: UPDATE 3-Time Inc getting new CEO ahead of magazine unit spinoff
column5: July 22 Time Warner Inc said it named a new chief executive to head its magazine titles People  Sports Illustrated and Time  which will soon be separated from the media conglomerate.

column4: Time Warner appoints new finance chief from Time Inc
column5: July 22 Time Warner Inc named a new chief financial officer on Monday  promoting the executive Howard Averill from its magazine unit that it plans to spin off later this year.

column4: Nippon Steel  Toyota raise steel sheet price by 10 pct - Nikkei
column5: July 23 Nippon Steel & Sumitomo Metal Corp  and Toyota Motor Corp have agreed to raise steel sheet prices by about 10 percent for April-September as yen falls  the Nikkei reported.

column4: U.S. steel pipe case against nine countries faces first hurdle
column5: WASHINGTON  July 22 The U.S. Commerce Department will decide on Tuesday whether to launch an investigation into charges that South Korea and eight other countries are selling about $1.8 billion of steel pipe in the United States at unfairly low prices  the department said.

column4: RPT-'R.I.P.D.' continues Hollywood's summer of big budget bombs
column5: LOS ANGELES  July 22 Universal Pictures' sci-fi action comedy "R.I.P.D." and Dreamworks Animation's "Turbo" opened with a thud in North American theaters this weekend  continuing a Hollywood streak of weekly box office bombs for films that cost more than $100 million to make.
